one_sentence_definition: Base-layer public blockchains that provide fundamental consensus, execution, and settlement for decentralized applications and assets.
Support for the Ethereum Virtual Machine and its tooling, enabling deployment and execution of Solidity smart contracts and Ethereum-compatible dApps.
Blockchains that use the Move language and VM for smart contract execution, offering different safety and resource models compared to EVM.
Layer-2 designs that split functions (sequencing, execution, fraud-proof/validity, data availability) across specialized components to improve scalability and UX.
L2 scaling solutions that post transaction data on L1 and assume correctness by default, using fraud proofs to resolve disputes.
Cryptographic proof systems used for succinct validity verification (including ZK rollups) and privacy-preserving proofs in scaling and privacy use cases.

keyword: Decentralized storage & data availability for blobs
one_sentence_definition: Protocols and DA layers focused on storing and serving large binary files (blobs) and ensuring data availability and redundancy across nodes.
Blockchain platforms and primitives specifically designed to natively host, index, verify, and economically coordinate ML models, datasets, and AI compute resources.
Tokenized marketplaces and primitives for publishing, licensing, selling, and rewarding contributions to datasets and ML models on-chain.
Distributed ML training techniques and incentive mechanisms that aggregate local model updates or peer predictions without centralizing raw data.
Techniques that apply zero-knowledge proofs to prove properties about ML models or their execution (e.g., correctness, provenance, privacy) without revealing sensitive inputs.
Services and protocols that reliably bring external (Web2 or chain) data on-chain and provide authenticated feeds for smart contracts.
On-chain identity systems and privacy-preserving verification (e.g., ZK proofs) to assert attributes or human/agent status without exposing private details.
Mechanisms, bridges, and protocol layers that enable secure transfer of assets and messages across distinct blockchains and execution environments.
Automated market makers, order books, and other decentralized primitives that enable permissionless trading, lending, and on-chain liquidity provision.
Standards, tooling, and services for representing real-world assets (property, loans, commodities) as on-chain tokens with compliance and custody considerations.
Non-traditional consensus designs that tie block production/validation rights to alternative economic resources (liquidity, stake, etc.) to align protocol incentives.
On-chain staking services, multisignature treasury controls, and related tooling for managing protocol funds, vesting, and validator/operator workflows.
Mechanisms that issue tradable derivative tokens representing locked liquidity positions so LPs can re-use capital and earn additional yield.

keyword: Account abstraction, gasless transactions & signature abstraction
one_sentence_definition: Protocol-level features and account models that decouple transaction signing/payment, enabling gasless UX, session keys, and customizable validation logic.
Smart-contract tooling, voting primitives, and governance frameworks used to coordinate protocol decisions, token-weighted votes, and treasury allocations.
Designs and applications that prioritize confidentiality (transaction privacy, private identities, private computation) using cryptographic primitives and privacy layers.
Marketplaces and orchestration layers that allocate, schedule, and verify distributed compute resources (GPU/CPU) for off-chain and on-chain workloads.
Autonomous or semi-autonomous software agents that interact with smart contracts and off-chain systems to perform tasks like trading, data collection, or resource management.
Standards and protocols for tokenized digital content, provenance tracking, composability, and interoperability across virtual worlds and IP licensing systems.
Blockchains and integrated toolkits optimized for game state, low-latency events, native game engines, and game-focused developer primitives.
Protocol suites and designs that enable a unified developer and asset experience across multiple chains using composable cross-chain primitives.
Low-latency, throughput-optimized execution features and order-routing primitives tailored for trading and exchange use cases at chain-level.

keyword: Developer SDKs, frameworks & composable smart contract layers
one_sentence_definition: Tooling, SDKs, and modular smart contract layers that speed up dApp development and enable composability across runtimes and chains.

keyword: On-chain model training/deployment marketplaces & model governance
one_sentence_definition: Platforms that coordinate and monetize on-chain training, model deployment, verifiable evaluation, and governance for ML models with tokenized incentives.
